title: Will never trust pics again
review: For much of Istanbul’s history, Sisli and the area just north of Taksim Square were open countryside used mostly as hunting grounds. These days, Sisli and its chic streets are considered the very heart of contemporary Istanbuli life, where an epicenter of fashion and a thriving business district meet to create an expressly “downtown” feel. Though largely a residential neighborhood, luxury hotels, fine dining restaurants, and upscale shops abound with many of them situated inside or nearby Cevahir Istanbul, the biggest shopping mall in Europe and second biggest urban shopping mall in the world. Shopaholics and fashionistas travel from near and far to browse the area's mix of major global brand items and creations by popular Turkish designers.

title: Complaints
review: This is simply a cheap (not budget) hotel with very deceiving pics that make you think it is some sort of boutique Hotel. The hotel is 6 stories with 2 rooms on each floor and the lobby is just a desk in the entrance right next to the breakfast area (I will never call it a buffet) The staff are very friendly but don't let this fool you, as behind these wonderful smiles there is a terrible customer experience.  Let's start with the rooms. They are fairly spacious compared to other rooms in istanbul small hotels, BUT, there is a major hygiene problem. The closets were dirty and had food crumbs and hair in them. There were ants in the toilet and last but not least, a used underwear stuffed between the wall and the nightstand (BIG EEEEW) The beds were hard and extremely uncomfortable. The rest of the furniture was old and rundown. Owner is  extremely rude and greedy. I cancelled my stay after 1 night stay although I lost 350 USD for it. Terrible hotel. They didn’t even want to give me back my money until I threatened them by calling  police I totally warn anyone against this hotel as it is the manifestation of the word (looks can be deceiving) and by that I mean the lovey pics you will see on the booking sites. …

title: Good location
review: We stayed in La Piano hotel for 5 nights and it was great. Our room was bigger than what we expected and was very clean. The breakfast was excellent with lots of new options every morning. Very nice and helpful staff.” Borak he is great man, I really enjoyed staying in this hotel because of him”

title: Very Good Hotel
review: It's a small hotel and good for 1or 2days staying.  So close to nişantaşi district and about 1-2minutes to osmanbey metro station.  Breakfast is poor. But friendly stuff.  Merve is great girl in reception.  Very lovely and friendly.  I prefer to stay again in this hotel for 1-2 days for business trips.  So close to famous restaurants in Istanbul in nişantaşi street. CITY'S Shopping mall is about 5-6minutes walk . it's full of brands.  Best clothes brands in the world are only 5minutes walk .

title: it was ok
review: Positives: 1- Super Friendly Staff, they treat you like a friend of them, and will try to help you in anything they can do. 2- Very good location, quite area, same time access to all important things, 2 Min walking from metro station, same thing for bus station, nearby super markets, restaurants, coffee shops and exchange office. 3- Very good value for money.  Negatives: 1- 1st day the room was missing some few stuff, but the bring them in the days after. 2- I wish that breakfast has more things on it.

title: Good value for money, nice location, one confusion experience
review: For much of Istanbul’s history, Sisli and the area just north of Taksim Square were open countryside used mostly as hunting grounds. These days, Sisli and its chic streets are considered the very heart of contemporary Istanbuli life, where an epicenter of fashion and a thriving business district meet to create an expressly “downtown” feel. Though largely a residential neighborhood, luxury hotels, fine dining restaurants, and upscale shops abound with many of them situated inside or nearby Cevahir Istanbul, the biggest shopping mall in Europe and second biggest urban shopping mall in the world. Shopaholics and fashionistas travel from near and far to browse the area's mix of major global brand items and creations by popular Turkish designers.

title: Good budget hotel
review: I booked 2 separate nights (Friday night & Sunday night) to stay in this hotel on my way to Cappadocia. I booked this hotel through booking.com, and have paid for both nights when I booked it.  When I checked in on Friday night, I arrived at Istanbul at almost midnight, so I got to the hotel quite late. Check in was smooth, and the guy at the reception speaks good English, he even helped me to carry my hand luggage to the family room (2 single beds, and one double bed). He was friendly, nice and pleasant.  When I checked in on Sunday night (after arriving from Cappadocia, and my pre-booked airport transfer with the agency who booked my Cappadocia tour, picked up the wrong passenger with the same first name as me, I waited for some time in the airport, feeling frustrated, and I…

title: nice hotel near taksim
review: We were there for a conference and stayed four nights. It was very close to our conference venue and walking distance from convenient public transport systems. The rooms were comfortable and cosy. No noise pollution. Rooms were clean and staff was prompt and helpful. They could not speak English very well but we could manage to communicate and had no problems whatsoever. Food was good. Our room did not have an electric water heater/kettle, so it was a little problematic. But overall stay was very pleasant. They also helped us with organizing tours and Bosphorous cruises. I would not mind starting at this hotel again.

title: Good for budget travellers
review: friendly staff, Arabic speaking and English ,nice and cozy warm  rooms,walking distance to taksim square , isteklal street, where you can find transportations to see all the city. hotel is also helping with tours packages.

title: not to expect much
review: The hotel has a fair price. The man at reception was very kind, they even give us a room way before check-in time. Our room was on the top floor where the elevator doesn't go up. We had three beds inside which made a bit more difficult to move.  What we really dislike was the breakfast we couldn't really find anything nice The location is fine,Taksim square is within walking distance.

title: Location, that's about it
review: For much of Istanbul’s history, Sisli and the area just north of Taksim Square were open countryside used mostly as hunting grounds. These days, Sisli and its chic streets are considered the very heart of contemporary Istanbuli life, where an epicenter of fashion and a thriving business district meet to create an expressly “downtown” feel. Though largely a residential neighborhood, luxury hotels, fine dining restaurants, and upscale shops abound with many of them situated inside or nearby Cevahir Istanbul, the biggest shopping mall in Europe and second biggest urban shopping mall in the world. Shopaholics and fashionistas travel from near and far to browse the area's mix of major global brand items and creations by popular Turkish designers.

title: La piano
review: I stayed for 6 nights (left one night earlier) at La Piano Istanbul and cannot recommend it. It is well located, within walking distance to the ICC (Istanbul Convention Center) , Taksim Square and the nice Nisantasi neighborhood, but that's about it. The room I stayed in was awfully dark, I could not even read a book at night! The TV had a bunch of Turkish-Speaking channels and it would only work now and then. Breakfast is absolutely poor; opening time from 8 to 10am, and by 9 you are not able to get any fresh coffee or tea. Lousy. Power shortages almost every night. For 100 Euros/night, I would stay somewhere else next time I am in Istanbul.

title: Excellent in compare to price
review: - staff were very nice and helpful - rooms ar vey clean but the king bed size is smaller than expected - food is fine but the dining area is very tight - price is reasonable  - location is excellent near to Othman Biek st, where you can find a variety of shopping outlets. -near to Takseem square. - address need to be more accurate.

title: Affordable and superb boutique hotel
review: Our experience in La piano had no misfortune and everything was appealing. La piano is located not far from action in the beautiful city of Istanbul.  to mention the good stuff about La Piano: - The staff are very friendly (more than you can imagine ), and they are good people - The room was clean and had all the facilities you can ask for - The internet was great, you can find a router in all floors which enables you to surf everywhere - The food, drinks and break fast was good and couldn't ask for more  - Hotel staff were flexible and they accepted different requests  I can't find anything bad or any recomendation for the hotel.  Keep up the good job gals

title: Friendly hotel close to International convention centre with big rooms
review: Finding a strategic hotel that is affordable is very difficult. Hotel La Piano came across a place that is in walking distance to historical and cultural centers such as Taksim Suquare, old Pera, Sisli and Osman Bey, very easy to transefer old city. It offers comfortable and cozy accomodation for an advantageous price.  My room was really super huge and comes with a kitchenette which I didn't even use coz of Turkish delicious food are plenty around the hotel. Although the staffs spoke little English, I was made welcome from the very moment I checked in. If you like, you can try the spa just at the basement of the hotel. They provide 'hamam' which is a steam bath or known as Turkish bath. Breakfast is simple Turkish delight but will sustain you till lunch time. In short, if want…

title: Thanks
review: For much of Istanbul’s history, Sisli and the area just north of Taksim Square were open countryside used mostly as hunting grounds. These days, Sisli and its chic streets are considered the very heart of contemporary Istanbuli life, where an epicenter of fashion and a thriving business district meet to create an expressly “downtown” feel. title: a very clean and caring spa
review: a very nice small hotel in middle of Istanbul , with a fantastic host , every think you need they will help you , nice spa , we had a room with balcony and extra treatment, clean room small bathroom , good breakfast ,v good location

title: Elite and  modern
review: i am much satisfied. the hotel manager (lady) is an able character. well managed entity.   i merely used the fitness center and the turkish bath. i did not have an overnight... however, it was obvious, the sleep quality must be good...  thanks and regards...

title: Teamaking facilities and iron in room would make this hotel perfect!
review: Nice place and friendly hotel.rooms are decorated as modern and comfortable . breakfast buffet has variety food.The Turkish bath is perfect. İf you could :) sauna is better than Turkish bath .thanks to the hotel's place,you could walk easily .

title: Excellent Accomodation
review: Great location, friendly staff. Only minor bugbears are lack of room service, lack of tea and coffee making facilities in room and lack of iron in hotel. Staff are friendly and go the extra mile. Nb extra duvets should be provided on colder days, even if the heating is on max, people sleeping by the window r will freeze otherwise.

title: HOTEL LA PIANO
review: For much of Istanbul’s history, Sisli and the area just north of Taksim Square were open countryside used mostly as hunting grounds. These days, Sisli and its chic streets are considered the very heart of contemporary Istanbuli life, where an epicenter of fashion and a thriving business district meet to create an expressly “downtown” feel. Though largely a residential neighborhood, luxury hotels, fine dining restaurants, and upscale shops abound with many of them situated inside or nearby Cevahir Istanbul, the biggest shopping mall in Europe and second biggest urban shopping mall in the world. Shopaholics and fashionistas travel from near and far to browse the area's mix of major global brand items and creations by popular Turkish designers.

title: small and uncomplicated
review: The hotel was good. Near the city mall & nisantasi. 15 min walk to taksim square.3 min walk to osmanbey metro. It was near to kabatash and dolmabahce palace.  The hotel is small but the rooms size were good. We stayed at family room and our friend in double room. The size of both of them was good. Rooms have air condition, safebox, sofa, one double and two single beds, closet and hair dryer. Hotel was very clean. Towels were changed every day. The bathroom was very clean. The staff was very kind and friendly exactly the  hotel manager Onur. Over all I recommend this hotel to every one who wants to stay in istanbul with best price.
